thing-type.label: ZV-9101 In-Wall Dimmer Module
thing-type.description: In-Wall Dimmer Module<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtZ-Wave Built-in receiver with dimmer function. Control input, AC 230V / DC 12V, for Pushdim. Max 400 W resistive load, 200 W LED. Front edge / Rear dimmer, adjustable lowest level. Compatible with Nexa Bridge and other Z-Wave controllers.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ul&gt<li&gtPress the "Reset" button 3 times within 3 seconds or</li&gt <li&gtpress 3 times on connected switch within 3 seconds</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ul&gt<li&gtSet the Z-Wave controller in the exclusion mode (see controller's manual)</li&gt <li&gtPress the "Reset" button 3 times within 3 seconds</li&gt </ul&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Saving load state
parameter.description: Saving load state before power failure<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtInfo: Saving load state before power failure 0 – shutoff load 1 – turn on load 2 – save load state before power failure</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Enable/disable to send report
parameter.description: basic report to the Lifeline when the load state changed<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable/disable to send the basic report to the Lifeline when the load state changed (When value set as 1, re-power on the dimmer, it will send Basic report automatically)</p&gt <p&gt0 – Disable to send Basic report</p&gt <p&gt1 – Enable to send Basic report</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Default fade time
parameter.description: Default fade time (unit is second)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefault fade time (unit is second, this value has the same function as Duration of Multilevel) Valid value: 0x00 - 0xFF</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtValue</td&gt <td&gtDescription</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0-127</td&gt <td&gt1 second to 127 seconds in 1 second resolution</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt128-254</td&gt <td&gt1 minute to 127 minutes in 1 minute resolution</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt255</td&gt <td&gtFactory default duration. (1 sec.)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: brightness value
parameter.description: Setting minimum brightness value<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSetting minimum brightness value Valid value: 0 - 50, the bigger the value is, the higher the load’s minimum brightness is Note: when configure this value, the value of Multilevel will be configured as 1 automatically so that users can preview the corre-sponding effect of minimum brightness value</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: MOSFET
parameter.description: Choose MOSFET<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtChoose MOSFET driving type 0 – trailing edge 1 – leading edge</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: removal from network
parameter.description: Enable/disable external switch to be added to and removed from a network<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable/disable external switch to be added to and removed from a network (when enables this function, triple press the external switch within 1.5 seconds to be added to or removed from a net-work) 0 – disable 1 - enable</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Emergency Shutoff<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe dimmer has accounted for Emergency Shutoff, when the temperature rises above 90°C, Emergency Shutoff is sent to Lifeline.</p&gt <p&gtSystem (0x09) Emergency Shutoff status</p&gt
